items.content_html:
Summary

Headers.prototype.getSetCookie was added to nodejs in v19.7.0 (undici v5.19.0) and updates other Header prototype methods that were missing node data.

Test results and supporting details

  • https://github.com/nodejs/undici/releases/tag/v5.19.0
  • nodejs/undici@ba5ef44
  • nodejs/node#46711

I implemented Headers in node so hopefully you can trust my sources ðŸ˜†

Related issues
items.title: Update nodejs data for api.Headers

items.content_html: This PR removes the RTCRtpContributingSource API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.
items.title: Remove RTCRtpContributingSource API from BCD

items.content_html:
This PR removes the [inbound/outbound]-rtp.qpSum member of the RTCStatsReport API from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v9.0.4).

Tests Used:
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/RTCStatsReport/inbound-rtp/qpSum
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/RTCStatsReport/outbound-rtp/qpSum
items.title: Remove api.RTCStatsReport.[inbound/outbound]-rtp.qpSum from BCD

items.content_html:
This PR removes the RTCIceServer API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.

Additional Notes: I'd love for someone to take on the content changes if possible, but if nobody is interested I'd be happy to give the content updates a shot!
items.title: Remove RTCIceServer API from BCD
new bcd: line-style enumerated type

items.content_html:
FF111 adds support for ScreenOrientation.lock() in nightly in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1767449
This is also behind a preference from FF97.

This adds the BCD entry. Related to mdn/content#26444
items.title: FF111 ScreenOrientation.lock() enabled preview (flag FF97)

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the aspect-ratio CSS property. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v9.0.4).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/aspect-ratio

Additional Notes: Safari 14 is completely guesstimated as I don't have access to 14.0, only 13.1 and 14.1.
items.title: Update Safari data for aspect-ratio CSS property

items.content_html:
Summary

As noted in #10456, the BCD includes notes about supported features in Edge and Opera for releases prior to the switch of those browsers to Chromium. As the pre-Chromium releases are unlikely to be targets for web extension deployment, took the opportunity to "mirror" all.

Related issues

Fixes #10456
items.title: webNavigation support in Edge and Opera

items.content_html:
This PR is a breakdown list of all the changes created by https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com v9.0.4 with the results collected as of April 24, 2023. Results are limited to 2020+ browsers in this collector run.

Note that this PR is not intended to be merged directly.
items.title: mdn-bcd-collector v9.0.4 breakdown list (2023-04-25)

data is copied from CSS overflow property.

items.content_html:
Summary

A patch has landed in the Blink source that enables the subgrid functionality if experimental features are turned on.
This makes the feature available under the 'experimental web platform features' flag in Chrome et al.

I've also changed the note to the new impl_url format.

Test results and supporting details

Corresponding commit: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/f7d47ed18bd6ed25c2b07c7919a32c67c1a7b73f

Related issues

N/A
items.title: Blink subgrid support graduated from 'test' to 'experimental'

items.content_html:
Summary

Fixes #9646
items.title: management.getSelf available in Opera

items.content_html:
This PR removes the disconnect.*_parameter member of the AudioNode API from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v9.0.2).

Tests Used:
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioNode/disconnect/destination_parameter
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioNode/disconnect/input_parameter

Additional Notes: The test function tests to see if the argument has been accessed. While this may produce false positives (especially in Chrome) when the value is checked but doesn't influence behavior, I can't think of a situation where a false negative could occur.
items.title: Remove api.AudioNode.disconnect.*_parameter from BCD

items.content_html:
Summary

Fixes #8780 by expanding the property details for cookies.CookieStore and marking incognito as unsupported in Chrome.

Also amended Edge support details for 79 or earlier to "mirror".
items.title: cookies.CookieStore property details
